qas.question: What can be harmed by pharmaceutical patents?

what concentrated intersts for tha benefit of the masses?

context: Some critics of <b6_0>intellectual property<b6_0/>, such as those in the free culture movement, point at <a4_0><b7_0>intellectual<b7_0/><a4_0/> monopolies as harming <a0_0><b5_0>health<b5_0/><a0_0/> (in the case of pharmaceutical patents), preventing progress, and benefiting concentrated interests to the detriment of <a1_0>the masses<a1_0/>, and argue that <a2_0><b8_0>the public<b8_0/><a2_0/> interest is harmed by ever-expansive monopolies in the form of copyright extensions, software patents, and business method patents. More recently scientists and engineers are expressing concern that <a3_0>patent<a3_0/> thickets are undermining technological development even in high-tech fields like nanotechnology.
